Package com.rapidminer.belt.util

Class SortingLong

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.util.SortingLong
  • public final class SortingLong
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for sorting long values efficiently (without autoboxing or converting them). The implementation is similar to the Sorting implementation for double values.
    Author:
    Kevin Majchrzak
    See Also:
    Sorting

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int[] sort​(long[] src, Order order)
      Indirect stable sort of long values using the given order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static int[] sort​(long[] src,
                         Order order)
        Indirect stable sort of long values using the given order. This method does not modify the given source array. Instead, it computes and returns an index mapping that if applied to the input results in a sorted sequence.
        Parameters:
        src - the source array (remains unchanged))
        order - the sorting order
        Returns:
        the index mapping resulting in a sorted sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source array or the order is null
